intro: Thlaspi eigii, commonly known as the alpine cabbages, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and clusters of small, yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually thick and fleshy, adapted to survive in cold, high-altitude environments. Thlaspi eigii is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
